content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM of the bold word

content.question: The letter looked to be from my long-lost uncle, but my mother suspected that it was bogus.
The ascendancy of the automobile meant the demise of the horse-drawn buggy.
Sara devised a plan that would allow us to visit roadside attractions along our route from Florida to Washington.
News of Carl’s delay evinced a frown from his grandfather.
Will was intimidated by the sheer weight of the tome assigned that week.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for the bold words

content.question: Not all decisions are irrevocable.
Martial law was imposed in Hawaii after the bombing of Pearl Harbor.
Taking pleasure in mundane details is key to happiness.
Dawn patronized her older brother by reminding him to wear a coat and gloves.
Several witnesses refuted her claim that she had never been in the restaurant before the robbery.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: A quirk of fate is most likely to be
The United States sometimes uses economic sanctions to try to influence policy in other countries. Sanctions are
Which best describes an object that is enshrined?
Which of the following is least likely to be considered memorabilia?
A querulous person is most likely to

passage: Jackson was excited. His stepmother, Shirley, was taking him to get his hair cut. Later that afternoon he would graduate from high school. He was glad he had Shirley to cheer him on today. There was nothing bogus about her. She’d become his stepmother when he was just three years old, and she’d been there for him ever since. He had enshrined the memory of each time she’d picked him up after a long day of work at the hospital to give him a big hug. Even as a teenager, every time he felt alone or needed strength, all he had to do was think of Shirley’s hugs.

He was thrilled that Shirley had sanctioned his plans to get a stylish new haircut the morning of graduation. Jackson planned to get a fade and have his favorite barber, Mr. Lee, shave a geometric design on one side. He grinned when they arrived at the barbershop they’d patronized for years. Jackson had learned a lot about life by talking to the regulars here. He even enjoyed listening to their querulous arguments because they made him think about current events in new ways.
As Mr. Lee began snipping Jackson’s hair, he sighed. Today was going to be amazing.

content.question: The meaning of bogus (line 4) is
In line 6, enshrined means
The word sanctioned (line 11) most nearly means
The meaning of patronized (line 15) is
In line 17, querulous most nearly means
